results.title: Frequency
results.brief_description: A mockumentary which takes an oft debated subject as its premise. Clever scripting combines with production and post-production elements including effective use of camera and editing to develop a range of age appropriate characters in an engaging way.
results.description: A mockumentary which takes an oft debated subject as its premise. Clever scripting combines with production and post-production elements including effective use of camera and editing to develop a range of age appropriate characters in an engaging way.

results.title: Bus stop
results.brief_description:
This animation employs a fearless use of monochrome to enhance its sophisticated intertextual referencing of classic cartoons. The original music both supports and acts as a counterpoint to the storyline.
‘Fast lane’ performed by Lucid.

results.title: The Black pages

Considered visual composition and a strong soundtrack support an intriguing storyline.

results.title: Amour de la toilette
results.brief_description:
Subtlety is the key to this brilliantly conceived hand drawn animation that employs the simple technology of a whiteboard and markers to create an engaging evocation of Paris. The use of minimalist materials is supported by thorough planning skills, the controlled use of camera and a storyline that is achievable within the limitations of the medium.
Music by The Cafe Accordian Orchestra.

results.title: Footprints on the Mountains
results.creator_credit: Denise Mack, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: At age 11 Denise Mack is told secretly by her mother that her heritage isn’t Irish, that her grandfather was Lebanese and her grandmother, Chinese. Through this story, Denise journeys along the path of her ancestry to bring her closer to herself.

results.title: Jidi
results.creator_credit: Stephen Pascoe, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Stephen Pascoe’s grandfather was diagnosed with cancer, he and his sister decided to preserve his memories by filming an interview with him.

results.title: Hyper-Ballad
results.creator_credit: Firas Massouh, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Firas Massouh’s hunger for travel was started by his father who, as a communist activist, moved to Russia from Syria where he met his wife. With baby in tow, the family began a lifelong journey of travelling, which was continued by Firas when he decided to continue his father’s travels and move to Melbourne.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Firas Massouh, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Firas Massouh’s hunger for travel was started by his father who, as a communist activist, moved to Russia from Syria where he met his wife. results.title: Hello Darling
results.creator_credit: Mike Helal, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Mike Helal left Lebanon at the height of the war and migrated to Melbourne. Reluctant to leave, Mike started to see the beauty of his new home. Despite this, nothing deters him as he waits to be reunited with his loved one again.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mike Helal, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
